website_summaries.verdict: Unique design, but we wish the manufacturer had added an omelette rack.
pros: Unique design, and unit "chirps" when eggs are done
cons: 7-egg capacity is less than we would have liked

customer_reviews.title: Cute, whimsical and functional.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Henrietta. My first one still works perfectly. I Purchased the second Henrietta because now I can do many eggs simultaneously. The eggs come out perfectly. Just remember to put your eggs in a bowl full of ice water after they are done. Then your eggs will peel perfectly. This product is so Whimsical. Henrietta chirps when your eggs are ready. When she is unplugged she also makes the cutest sound. The only downside is that for some bizarre reason they used a nonstick surface where the water goes. It doesn’t affect the eggs adversely whatsoever. It would’ve been nice to have a stainless steel interior though.
customer_reviews.author: Texicana

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love Henrietta! So quick and easy to use. I like poached eggs for breakfast, but didn't make them on work days because it was inconvenient to stay at the stove while getting ready in the morning. Now I fill with water to desired line, spray the 4-sectioned divider lightly with non stick spray, crack an egg into the tray and cover. When I walk away the eggs are perfectly cooked and it whistles loudly enough to hear from another room when eggs are done. The only thing that would make it better for ME is if it would cackle like a hen... but my husband says that he would throw it out if it did. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed with the plastic
customer_reviews.text: Used once and sent back. it worked great and my eggs were perfect. After using I took and put eggs in cool water. When I returned that afternoon to show it off and do it again, the pieces no longer fit together because maybe the insert warped. It had also already discolored inside. I ordered a different egg cooker that was all metal but haven't used it yet. Hopefully it is better. She is cute. I wish she had lasted better.
customer_reviews.author: mickey losinski

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I had this very item for years and it worked great but finally stopped working. So I ordered a replacement from amazon. It came but was defective. The buzzer didn’t work so that when I checked on it, the plastic had melted to the heating plate. I reported it and got a replacement right away. However the replacement has also malfunctioned. The buzzer works but the plastic egg holder doesn’t fit right on the metal heating plate so now all the water boils over all over the counter and doesn’t cook the eggs thoroughly. Now I just want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Docheff

customer_reviews.title: Don't put all your eggs in this basket!
customer_reviews.text: Major disappointment! This hen leaks all over my counter, which causes it to lose water and not cook completely. I have to run the cooking cycle twice, just to get hard boiled eggs. I have to put a plate under the hen to keep the water contained. I'm afraid I'm going to have an electric short with all the water! She does not cluck when she is done, she beeps like a bad alarm clock. Everything I liked about this hen is a farce! Unfortunately, I missed my return window by four days! Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Reader for Life!

customer_reviews.title: Leaks All Over the Counter
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, our Henrietta cannot hold her water! She leaks all over the counter. Once the water leaks out, the cooker beeps to signal the eggs are done, but they are not. I have to run the cooker twice to get the eggs done, which makes twice the mess on the counter. I've had it too long to send back so it's headed for the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Stix

customer_reviews.title: Solves the buzzer problem
customer_reviews.text: We had a Dash egg cooker, which worked fine, except that the alarm when the eggs were done was way too loud and piercing. It would be appropriate for a fire alarm or nuclear accident. Every time it surprised me, I lost years off my life. This Henrietta has an electronic tone that is loud enough to hear from another room, but it's gentle enough to avoid triggering a heart attack. It sounds like a notification, not an alarm. You still have to unplug it. An automatic shutoff would be better. But we highly recommend this egg cooker. For us, it was well worth a few extra bucks to have an appropriate "done" alert.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well and the eggs are easy to shell
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The eggs are VERY easy to shell. Drawbacks: If you don't put the lid on right, this creates a puddle of water on your counter. Also, It's a little tricky to clean the hard water buildup. All in all, I recommend it for anyone who likes hard-cooked eggs.
customer_reviews.author: cherab

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. I don't think she's used it yet, so I really cannot give a reliable account of it's capabilities. I loved the chicken motif; and my sister has the same product that she's used for years, and still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma D.

customer_reviews.title: Maverick SEC-2 Henrietta Hen Egg Cooker - High-Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This hen is the BEST egg cooker. We have had one for several years and bought two for gifts this year to fulfill requests. We use it often and it never fails to do a good job. It hard boils eggs accurately and in a timely manner, with no fuss. It's one of those "why didn't I think of that" products. Follow the egg insertion instructions, listen for the chirp and they're cooked. This consumer rates Henrietta Hen five stars for attractiveness, quality of construction, simplicity of use and functionality. It is well worth your investment.
customer_reviews.author: Cat  Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Cute and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Cute and convenient egg cooker. We raise chickens and this is the perfect appliance to cook some of the many eggs they provide us. Henrietta is very easy to use and she looks so cute sitting on the shelf waiting to be of assistance
customer_reviews.author: Donnie in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk! I bought it to make poached eggs. The yolk gets cooked before the white sets. The water level markers are way off. I filled it past the hard boil level and they still weren’t done.
customer_reviews.author: mkurth

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of Junk!!! It doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of Junk!!! It doesn't work. The water boils out all over the counter and the yolks are half cooked. I made sure it was level and put the exact amount of water required. I even let the eggs warm to room temperature, but it didn't make any difference. I'm returning this. It infuriates me that I have to pay to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. Pouy

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Will buy as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: I love the whimsy of this egg cooker. Even better, it has an integrated egg piercer and measuring marks in the bottom of the cooker. That means you can never lose vital pieces. I'm so happy I went with this item instead of buying another variety.
customer_reviews.author: Eristic

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!  Yah, it only whistles when done, but it does chirp when you pull the plug!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit I was skeptical at first, due to some negative comments by others, but I love this darned bird! HA! Have used it at least five times since having purchased, cooking 7 hard boiled eggs at a time, with every time a winner! What's even better is that right after I toss the hot eggs into cold water, then crack them a bit, the shells peel right off with no effort!!!!! I'd buy this one again!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: She cooks eggs perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to cook eggs. I’ve now had three of them for several years. They don’t break I sadly gave the two I had when I moved. I was so glad to see they were still made so I could replace her. She’s a gem!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Bee Honey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Cute Design for Counter
customer_reviews.text: This item is a little hard to get use to but once used a few time does a good job if you are in a hurry in the morning. Doesn't require much attention and eggs are done the way you like them.
customer_reviews.author: Seafaricat

customer_reviews.title: Nice egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and made hard boiled eggs perfectly! I was a bit disappointed at the lack of a chicken noise signaling that eggs are done. It just makes an alarm sound.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Left the Coop
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd one and now the last one. Bought a few as gifts only to hear complaints about the hen not cooking eggs long enough; my 2nd one broke down, I ordered another one and it only lasted a year. I’m online right now trying to find another brand as well as a better one. I don’t recommend this one any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Best way to Hard Boil Eggs - Hands Down!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews, I found 1 complaint in common. This unit works great for 1 purpose - Hard Boil Eggs. Anything else gets questionable results. Tried it out and was amazed! It is perfect every time. Fill the bottom to the hard mark (aprox 3/4 cups) with water. There is a needle built into the housing where you would poke the egg on one end.15 -20 minutes later you hear Henrietta clucking away. Unplug, rinse the eggs in cool water and done. The housing is compact to fit on any counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use to make perfect hard boiled eggs!
customer_reviews.text: Best hard boiled egg cooker ever! I already owned a Henrietta Hen, then was happy to have found they still sold the same one so to give as a gift. Hard boiled eggs are so easy to do with this. I was skeptical when I bought mine over 10 years ago, but it's so easy to use. It chirps when it's done.
customer_reviews.author: Malsmum

customer_reviews.title: A keeper..never fails
customer_reviews.text: This is the best egg cooker ever....bought several as gifts...all still working...easy to use..easy to clean and store..the chicken chirps when eggs are done...love it
customer_reviews.author: Carol Agrillo

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: I had egg-cooker envy of my sister's Cuisinart model, but the only ones I could find are 10+ egg options. It's only for my husband and I and we only do 3-4 poached eggs at a meal, so Henrietta works out great for us! I wish she would chirp when finished, as she sounds like an alarm clock which is moderately annoying, but with great poached eggs (and hard boiled too for salads or for a snack) - it's hard to complain!
customer_reviews.author: jangone

customer_reviews.title: Love My Henrietta Hen!
customer_reviews.text: I make a lot of deviled eggs as my go-to appetizer for dinners. potlucks, picnics, etc. I don't know what I would do if I didn't have Henrietta Hen! I had such a hard time, for years, properly boiling an egg. Either the shell wouldn't peel off, it was overcooked or undercooked, shells cracking, etc. Now they always come out perfectly. People love my deviled eggs and I always mention Henrietta. Anyone can easily make a perfect hard boiled egg with this egg cooker! I found one at a yard sale for $1.00 and after she stopped chirping many years later, I ordered another.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: I love my chicken!
customer_reviews.text: Just used it yesterday for deviled eggs and they came out perfectly. Need to watch when you first open it, though, as the "pin" that you pierce the end of the egg with is not tagged so you see it, so I stuck myself! If you read the Instruction book first, then you know and won't get stuck like me. That was the only drawback and I still love it. If you love chickens and boiled or poached eggs, then this is the hen for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this great product for my daughters.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my original Henrietta years ago. I never had one problem. It chirped, it never leaked. It made perfect hard boiled eggs. My daughters were talking about boiled eggs on Easter and the best way to cook them. I decided to order each of them their own Henrietta. I think they will love her as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: jo palmer

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not very well-made. Used only a ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute, but not very well-made. Used only a few times before it sparked and smoked and over-heated. It was scary, but no one got hurt and only one egg got scorched.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Massingill

customer_reviews.title: No function out of the box
customer_reviews.text: When I took this item out of the box to use it for the first time, I read the instruction, washed the pieces as instructed, set up eggs and water for a first cooking, plugged it in to my normal kitchen counter socket -- and POP FIZZ POOF -- a huge spark appeared at the egg cooking unit, a huge poof of smoke shot up -- the thing shorted out immediately. Not an auspicious recommendation for the product. I've sent it back and will try another but am disappointed at this point.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Hock

customer_reviews.title: product not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I gave this egg cooker to my sister for a gift. I have just found out that it stopped working soon after she received it. Had I known, it could have been returned. Not worth the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: CHJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest way to make broil eggs ever. We use it a lot!!! Not that easy to clean but I can bear with that. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Cute
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used this egg cooker the eggs hard boiled just like we wanted them. The stacking parts mishaped a bit and we wondered if it is okay or should we return Henrietta. So we gave her one more chance and decided, she's a keeper. She cooked the eggs perfectly, she is cute and her changing shape in her stacking parts changed to stack nicely. Also there is no reason to have a sealed top. I doubt we use her for poached eggs as she is a type of plastic. She may have her nest on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but Im not happy at all with it
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cute item, but Im not happy at all with it. I wish the parts fit correctly, the chicken top doesn't really sit correctly on the part where you put the eggs. And where you add the water it looks awful I have washed it, and it looks all faded and ugly like its dirty. :( So sad cause its so cute!!!
customer_reviews.author: mari

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this product!! Where has it been? My eggs turn out Perfect every single time!! No more hard to peel boiled eggs!! Will be buying for gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Best egg cooker ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's great! Cooks eggs without any fuss and peeling is fantastic! I used to have trouble sometimes peeling eggs, as I'm sure many people do. This is wonderful! The shells peel off so easily and now I look forward to cooking hard boiled eggs. I haven't tried it for poached eggs yet but will soon. I definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: travelinsally

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Boiled Egg Transformer
customer_reviews.text: Her beak fell off after a couple of months use, but this did not seem to affect hard boiled egg production! Great product and makes perfect eggs. Must clean heater after use or use distilled water because surface of heater gets grungy.
customer_reviews.author: Martin A. Sala

customer_reviews.title: I Love Henrietta
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money I have spent in a while. I can cook a perfect hard boiled egg every time but I don't like spending time watching the water boil. This is the easiest way to make hard boiled eggs. Eggs are a great protein to have on hand to easily add to dishes and now it is simple to keep them in the fridge. Plus Henrietta cracks me up. She is a great addition to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME HENRIETTA!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Henrietta in 20 years! This one is even better than the first. It makes perfect hard boiled eggs! I haven't tried it for the poached yet, but I plan on it. She's fast, easy and the EGGS are easy to peel!!!! Thank you Maverick!!!
customer_reviews.author: yarvet

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for chicken lovers!
customer_reviews.text: Really does a nice job with the eggs and is SO cute. I really love it. Would give it 5 stars but it doesn't chirp like stated. Only chirped once or twice very quietly however, it does have a buzz to alert you. Otherwise, it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: easiest hard boiled eggs to peel
customer_reviews.text: My Mom gave this to me 20 years ago and I love it. But it finally stopped working. So I immediately bought another one. Makes peeling hard boiled eggs a breeze. A must have if you like hard boiled eggs. Haven't tried the poached or soft boiled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... purchasing 3 of these as Christmas gifts - everyone loved them! They make great poached eggs and are ...
customer_reviews.text: We ended up purchasing 3 of these as Christmas gifts - everyone loved them! They make great poached eggs and are a great "White Elephant" type of gift for exchanges.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflowerstars

customer_reviews.title: Ok...but!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've liked the consistency of this product for more than a year I've had it. It makes eggs at the level of cooking ( soft, medium, or hard boiling) that one wants every time, and my kids like the chirping It makes when the eggs are done. However, the inside water tray, even when cleaned periodically with vinegar, corrodes and has started to release black particles. As such, I'm replacing the product because we love boiled eggs, but I won't be getting another Henrietta, but rather one with stainless water base.
customer_reviews.author: Damonte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: As with most products I order from Amazon I am more than pleased with the product and if there is a problem you make it very easy to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this was a present for my daughter she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Lyn D

customer_reviews.title: when you cook 7 eggs on hard setting it water well dries out
customer_reviews.text: water well dries out on hard cook setting. Leaves burn marks on egg. Alarm sound when done cooking is very low , easy to recognize the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Duffy01

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Eggs Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I love my Henrietta! In fact, love it so much that I bought one for a friend as well. Easiest way ever to cook eggs. You can have them any level of doneness by simply adjusting the water level in the unit; I even add a few drops more or less than the preset lines to accommodate the exact doneness I need each time.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Henrietta laid an egg, and it isn't a golden one.
customer_reviews.text: Selected this one based on the reviews, but sadly, Henrietta is going back to the roost...she might hard boil, she might soft boil, she might be the great-great granddaughter of Chicken Little, but she doesn't poach eggs, and that's why I bought her.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to cook eggs!
customer_reviews.text: I love Henrietta Hen. It is the easiest way to boil eggs. You don't need to use a pot or a timer. Just add the right amount of water and the eggs and you'll get them perfectly cooked each time. I can't imagine cooking my eggs the old way anymore - this is just so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the shape of the egg poacher - it's really cute though.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary S.

customer_reviews.title: keeping it
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars but it does drip water every time I use it. I put a towel around the bottom to catch the water. I like how it cooks the eggs and they are always easy to peel. Am keeping it and putting up with the leaking water.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Poaching Eggs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to poach eggs. It works well but the poached eggs are not all cooked the same because the compartments are 2 slightly different shapes because the tray is oval. Also it is a little awkward to remove the eggs because the handle is in the center of the poaching tray. I think it looks good, seems sturdy, and is compact which makes it a good choice for my camper.
customer_reviews.author: LSO

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works great, would have given it a 5 star but the chirping needs to be a little louder.
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: Henrietta is a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a male friend who always complained of breaking his fried eggs. He is quite happy with Henrietta. Besides that, the neighbors who come in always want to know what that cluck sound is. It is a great conversation piece in his home. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Leo813

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: It does everything as advertised. The only thing I don't like is that it does drip because the top doesn't fit well. I still use it often and as long as you clean it after each use I see no reason this won't last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Do you have any easy way to clean this?
customer_reviews.text: Henrietta is great except for our farm eggs run it over because they are so big. It is also hard to clean. Would like any suggestions that anyone may have on cleaning. Does it do good to spray it with oil?? We live in the bush of Alaska and do not have a automatic dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: edna

customer_reviews.title: it's just a buzzer like any other egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say, it does not "chirp", it's just a buzzer like any other egg cooker. It's also a little touchy with how much water you put in or it will overflow. Other than that, good enough not to return.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I give this 3 stars because it does work to boil eggs. However, the Teflon or metal part is all chipped off and I am not sure how safe it is to use anymore and it leaves a big puddle of water around it while it's cooking the eggs. The lid also does not fit properly on the base and there is no on/off switch, you just have to unplug it to turn on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Kittee

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Love the hen, however, it leaks when cooking eggs all over counter surfaces, cannot use it. Not made of quality plastic, doesn't seal when hard boiling the eggs, love the chirping it makes though!! Too late to return
customer_reviews.author: Laura N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy for Soft-boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for soft-boiled eggs. They turned out runny, so probably need to add a tiny bit more water than it says. Still way easier than actually trying to soft-boil them!
customer_reviews.author: gargamel314

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, save time and last for ever.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Henrietta that stop chirping after about 23 years of great service. I bought a new one exactly like the old one and it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Durand

customer_reviews.title: Warps after one use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great once. If this were a disposable egg cooker I would say it was fantastic. However after the first use the egg tray warped and would not sit flush on the cooker. Intend on returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon McAndrew

customer_reviews.title: This is great except one thing the noise maker is not loud ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a Henrietta for years and died. My wife and I have wanted another. This is great except one thing the noise maker is not loud enough to hear across the kitchen to let you know when it is done. It cooks the eggs just right.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect eggs to devil.
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect hard boiled eggs with no purple around the yolks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fazekas

customer_reviews.title: failed product
customer_reviews.text: It worked great in the beginning. After a month the eggs didn't get done and water leaked out so the whole area where it sat was soaked. Would not but it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed, eggs undercooked
customer_reviews.text: The design is poorly constructed, the flimsy plastic pieces don't fit together, causing leakage and leaving the eggs terrible undercooked - even if you let them boil for a couple of minute through the chirping. I used it twice and neither time the eggs were edible. It's such a pity because I would have loved to have this cute hen sit on my kitchen counter, but looks aren't everything. Back in the box and return to Amazon it is. Zero stars (but Amazon forces me to pick one).
customer_reviews.author: Vienna82

customer_reviews.title: cooks the eggs but no chirp
customer_reviews.text: Works well to cook eggs but does not chirp. I have to keep an eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tropico

customer_reviews.title: Henrietta Hen Egg Cooker
customer_reviews.text: It works good except it takes a little more water in this area than is suggested. Another bad thing is that it leaks water onto my countertop. I really like the idea. The eggs are cooked faster than if you boil them on the stove. They seem to be easier to peel.
customer_reviews.author: Frances A. Linn

customer_reviews.title: fine tuning the egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: This egg cooker is a nice addition to any kitchen. It should get a lot of comments just on its appearance alone. You will have to do some fine tuning as you experiment with the amount of water to use to get your eggs cooked the way you like them. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Honey

customer_reviews.title: Does work after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this item 2 times. Now it doesn’t work and it’s past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Kulinski

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Egg Cooker Around
customer_reviews.text: I received my Henrietta Hen Egg Cooker on Tuesday and right away I used it to make hard boiled eggs for breakfast the next morning. This little egg cooker hard boiled my eggs to perfection in just a few minutes. No nasty hard boiled egg smell in my kitchen! The yolks were perfectly cooked no gray/green. I'm so happy I bought this. I used it again last night to make hard boiled eggs for deviled eggs and again the machine worked perfectly. I did not have any issues with the non-stick surface as other have noted. For $19.99 you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: LillyV

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE A CHARM!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one for years and use it twice a month. Bought the last 2 for relatives who make deviled eggs and have had problems making hard-boiled eggs. There is no guessing with "Henrietta". She times it just right!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE Henrietta!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Henrietta. She cooks perfect eggs every time. Perfect for breakfast, egg salad sandwhiches, potato salad. You name it she meets your needs. I wouldnt' change a thing about her. She is PERFECT the way she is. I bought a second one for our summer home - because i couln't live without her.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna Harris

customer_reviews.title: The kids love fixing hard boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: Wheel of Henrietta hen we had our first Henrietta hen for 30 years this is its replacement
customer_reviews.author: Fran Brown

customer_reviews.title: Flaky
customer_reviews.text: The egg cooker works pretty much as advertised, but the non-stick or whatever coating inside the water area has almost completely flaked off. This wouldn't be horrible if it didn't get all over the eggs and make a huge mess each time. I would not recommend this egg cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: works well for boiling, and poaching
customer_reviews.text: I used my Henrietta until it quit after about 10 years. It made perfect hard boiled and poached eggs. I never tried soft boiled. After it quit, I purchased another egg cooker and wish I had gotten another Henrietta instead
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so pretty and it poached my egg perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: betty moore

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gadget
customer_reviews.text: I was fortunate to see this cool kitchen gadget in action one lunch hour at my office. It was so quick and easy to operate and yielded the most perfect hard boiled eggs! I immediately went on the hunt to get one. Amazon provided the best price and fastest availability. The adorable design and whistle of the hen when eggs are cooked makes this my top kitchen appliance of all time! I highly recommend this product to all egg lovers. No more cracked eggs bouncing in hot water for me!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who loves to have hard boiled eggs for snacks but hated making them. Thought this would be a great solution. After the 2nd use we noticed black specs all over the eggs. Turns out the black coating was starting to peel in several spots. We were bummed, but ended up returning the item and have gone back to boiling batches of eggs on the stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: Kat A.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Does not have auto shutoff. Is this designed to burn up the cooker? Not Safe!
customer_reviews.author: M Akers

customer_reviews.title: Henrietta is "GREAT"
customer_reviews.text: I love hard boiled eggs and making them in Henrietta Hen is so easy and the eggs come out perfect. When I told my daughter about it she wanted one too so I had one sent to her. She had the same perfect results.
customer_reviews.author: Elliebabe

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and makes great eggs
customer_reviews.text: Henrietta is a quick no-fuss way to make eggs- and no more forgetting you left the eggs on the stove to boil. Knowing how much water to add takes a bit of experimenting, but once you've got that down, you are set!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn G

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Henrietta cooks eggs perfectly and was a hit when the grandchildren are here too! She chirps when the eggs are done! I posted pics of her on facebook and everyone loved it too! She is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Larimore

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker
customer_reviews.text: My second one. Replaced the one I had for 15 yrs just love it
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Sims

customer_reviews.title: It is fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: The eggs come out quite tasty and in a fraction of the time as boiling the eggs. The thing I don't love is that sometimes the water leaks out around the edge, but I guess it just boils over?
customer_reviews.author: CAMcMama

customer_reviews.title: Good egg cooker.
customer_reviews.text: Cooked the eggs well but it is a little difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: KSP

customer_reviews.title: the chirp is a lie
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job, sometimes if you don't put enough water in though it can "burn" it make it a pain to clean up. Also this so called "chirping when done" is more like an annoying beeping until you unplug it from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Muffin

customer_reviews.title: great idea poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: I love it's look, and it appears to cook eggs really well and accurately. However, the black paint has already begun to flake off, and the plastic housing for eggs and the top are very difficult to fit tightly because they appear to warp when hot. And it beeps when done rather than chirp, I was so ready for a chicken sound as the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for what we needed--makes exactly the right kind of poached egg and you don't have to pour off any water. At this price it's a real bargain, and it looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: John Richard Boren

customer_reviews.title: HENRIETTA HEN EGG COOKER
customer_reviews.text: Henrietta laid an egg. She could not cook my extra large eggs. Poor Henrietta is just to thin. The top half of Henrietta is not a good fit either. I think Henrietta's water broke because I found it on my counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Bling

customer_reviews.title: Wow. No effort required.
customer_reviews.text: I always had trouble making hard boiled eggs where the egg yolk didn't turn green after cooking. This little gadget took care of that for me and the eggs peeled beautifully. I even tried making the poached eggs, which I have never tried to do before and I loved them as well. If you like either of these, you won't be sorry if you buy this. It's really great. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered works great would recommend to anyone who boils eggs. Stephanie
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: We had a Henrietta Hen for over 5 years before she finally bit the dust. She was used at least 2 times a week, making perfect hard boiled everytime. When she died, we got a brand new one right away. Great gift to give too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Cooks to perfection
customer_reviews.text: Best thing since sliced bread! My daughter loved mine, so I got her one too.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: We had an Oster egg cooker growing up, purchased from a garage sale years ago. It still works perfectly, so I went hunting for one of my own. Henrietta is cuter than you'd think, cooks perfectly and offers super easy clean-up. Much CHEAPer than other products not nearly this quality.
customer_reviews.author: EAC

customer_reviews.title: Needs to cluck!
customer_reviews.text: Works well....just wish Henrietta actually clucked rather beeped when done!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly MacElroy Smith

customer_reviews.title: love how fast it cooks the eggs
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years, love how fast it cooks the eggs. Just the 2 of us here so much easier than the pot of water
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Maverick SEC-2 Henrietta Hen Egg Cooker, White
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It cooks eggs any way you wish. It is a fun novelty and adds some pizazz to your cooking as welll as being practical!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES E. ROSS

customer_reviews.title: Cute but VERY Drippy!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for me and one for my daughter. Both drip all over the counter as the water temp rises. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but hard to get exact doneness
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute cooker and works well. Only problem is that it is hard to figure out the correct amount of water to add in order to get the eggs cooked to the level of doneness you want.
customer_reviews.author: Ayla Secura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd purchase one for me and 2 gifts.
customer_reviews.author: S Bayne

customer_reviews.title: Henrietta Hen Egg Cooker Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Henrietta Hen arrived quickly and was packed securely. It boiled the 7 eggs to perfection. We raise our own chickens and use a lot of eggs, and the fresher the egg it always seemed, the harder they were to peel, not with Henrietta! For some reason, after the eggs were cooked and cooled, they ALL peeled like a dream, the shell came off in two pieces! It's a fun product to use and also looks cute just sitting on our counter.
customer_reviews.author: SneakyCat

product_meta.title: Maverick SEC-2 Henrietta Hen Electric Rapid Egg Cooker Poacher for Soft, Hard Boiled or Poached Eggs, Up to 7 Eggs
product_meta.description:
Make hard, soft or poached eggs in a snap. Quickly make perfectly cooked eggs by choosing the preferred type; Poached, Soft or Hard. Henrietta's rack can cook up to 7 hard or soft boiled eggs and poaching tray up to 4 poached eggs. A fun, retro design as Henrietta is shaped and stylized like a hen, which chirps when your eggs are ready. Piercing pin helps prevent shells from cracking. Most parts are dishwasher safe for your convenience. Includes hen lid, egg cooking rack, poaching rack and base/heating plate.

AMAZON.COM
Whether you're making eggs Benedict for brunch or egg-salad sandwiches for school lunches, or if you just have a big, hungry family eager for breakfast, this cute device boils or poaches eggs to order and "chirps" when the eggs are cooked. Beneath Henrietta the hen's ample form there's a poaching tray that holds four eggs and a cooking rack that holds seven. Tray, rack, and Henrietta nest on a power base. Pour water into the base to one of three levels for soft-, medium-, or hard-boiled eggs; puncture their big ends with the piercing pin in a separate cooking-rack cavity to prevent shells from cracking; plug in the power base; and steam cooks the eggs. The tray, which requires water at level two, rests on the cooking rack if poached eggs are desired. Afterward, all the hard plastic parts except the power base can go in the dishwasher. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: MAKE HARD, SOFT OR POACHED EGGS IN A SNAP - Quickly make perfectly cooked eggs by choosing the preferred type; Poached, Soft or Hard
LARGE CAPACITY - Rack can cook up to 7 hard or soft boiled eggs and poaching tray up to 4 poached eggs
FUN RETRO DESIGN - Henrietta is shaped and stylized like a hen, which chirps when your eggs are done cooking
PIERCING PIN - Piercing pin prevents shells from cracking; dishwasher-safe removable parts
INCLUDES - Hen lid, egg cooking rack, poaching tray and base/heating plate
